availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John A. Rose (Powell County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Powell County, Kentucky, farmer and carpenter. Kentucky native. Son of Powell Rose and Nancy Rose. Married to Lucretia Adams Rose. Father of Sarah J. Rose, Martha Rose, Mary E. Rose, Stephen R. Rose, and Anna B. Rose. Laborer in Montgomery County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Powell County in 1860. Carpenter in Powell County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District No. 2, p. 51B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Powell County, p. 21.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Powell County, Precinct No. 2, p. 136B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Powell County, KY, October 1863, p. 102.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994053, Powell County Births.
"John Aspen Rose (1828-1889)," Find A Grave, Memorial 24180078, Accessed August 5, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/24180078.
